Migraine.description: A neurological condition characterized by intense, debilitating headaches often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound.
Migraine.treatment: Pain relievers, rest in a quiet dark room, preventive medications.

Dengue.description: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing high fever, rash, and muscle and joint pain.
Dengue.treatment: Fluids, pain relievers (avoid aspirin), and rest. Severe cases need hospitalization.

Diabetes.description: A metabolic disorder resulting in high blood sugar levels over a prolonged period.
Diabetes.treatment: Dietary changes, regular exercise, insulin or oral medications.

Chicken pox.description: A highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy skin rash with red spots and blisters.
Chicken pox.treatment: Calamine lotion, antihistamines, and antiviral drugs for severe cases.

Common Cold.description: A viral respiratory infection with symptoms like sore throat, runny nose, and coughing.

Fungal infection.description: Skin or internal infections caused by fungi, often leading to itching, redness, and rashes.
Fungal infection.treatment: Antifungal creams, powders, or oral medications.

Pneumonia.description: A lung infection that inflames air sacs, potentially filling them with fluid.
Pneumonia.treatment: Antibiotics, rest, and fluids; severe cases may require hospitalization.

Allergy.description: An immune system reaction to a foreign substance not typically harmful to the body.

Vertigo.description: A sensation of spinning dizziness, often related to inner ear problems.
Vertigo.treatment: Vestibular rehabilitation, medications like meclizine or diazepam.

Hypertension.description: High blood pressure, often without symptoms but can lead to heart problems if untreated.
Hypertension.treatment: Lifestyle changes, exercise, low-sodium diet, medications.

Jaundice.description: Yellowing of the skin and eyes due to high bilirubin levels, often caused by liver issues.
Jaundice.treatment: Depends on cause — rest, hydration, medications for liver support.

Tuberculosis.description: A serious infectious disease that mainly affects the lungs, caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis.

Malaria.description: A disease caused by Plasmodium parasites, transmitted via mosquito bites.
Malaria.treatment: Antimalarial medications like chloroquine or artemisinin combination therapy.

Hepatitis B.description: A viral infection that attacks the liver and can cause both acute and chronic disease.
Hepatitis B.treatment: Antiviral medications, regular monitoring, liver care.

Hepatitis C.description: A blood-borne viral infection that causes liver inflammation.

Heart attack.description: Occurs when blood flow to a part of the heart is blocked.
Heart attack.treatment: Emergency medical care, aspirin, clot busters, and surgery (angioplasty or bypass).

Drug Reaction.description: Adverse reaction to medication with symptoms like rashes, fever, or swelling.

Acne.description: A skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells.
